title: tvplus006
author: tvplus006
content: "On November 11, 2022, Ukraine starts assembling the world’s first Naval Fleet of Drones!It will protect the waters of Ukrainian seas and also peaceful cities from cruise missiles launched by russian forces from their ships. It will unblock a corridor for civilian vessels that carry grain for the whole world.Ukrainians, together with donors from 110 countries, are creating the world's first "fleet of marine drones". Our first task is to assemble a fleet of 100 such vessels. One naval drone is worth - 250,000 USD". Join in! https://u24.gov.ua/navaldrones

comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: Thanks for sharing it here, but I think it'll probably get moved to some other board like Politics and Society. Today's a good day, with Kherson finally being liberated.As for the donations, I wonder why they didn't add the crypto button for the drone fleet, as generally, United24 accepts donations in crypto donations in Bitcoin, Ethereum and several other currencies, albeit via a payment processing system, not directly onto a Bitcoin address. Even their Army of Drones page has a crypto option. I hope the fleet page will get this button as well.

comments.author: so98nn
comments.body: I knew it, we will have new inventions during the war is going on. Well though it might be piece of technology that is already in the play but this is something good and new. Moreover it’s amusing to see that how various countries are already coming together to give a light to this project. I am not sure how successful it is going to be after seeing the aftermath of current math but just check the incredible technology that they have built. The detailing has been done very nicely. Hope so donations come by pretty well.

comments.author: tvplus006
comments.body: Quote from: kryptqnick on November 11, 2022, 02:57:49 PM...Today's a good day, with Kherson finally being liberated.As for the donations, I wonder why they didn't add the crypto button for the drone fleet, as generally, United24 accepts donations in crypto donations in Bitcoin, Ethereum and several other currencies, albeit via a payment processing system, not directly onto a Bitcoin address. ..Yes, this really inconveniences cryptocurrency holders, especially since there is such an option to make donations in cryptocurrency on the same site. I think that the developers will make changes in the near future. Nevertheless, according to Mikhail Fedorov, who is the minister of digital transformation of Ukraine, enough funds have already been collected for the first marine drone. It will be called Kherson - https://t.me/zedigital/2615.

comments.author: DrBeer
comments.body: Ukraine very quickly moved from the old Soviet concept of building an army and conducting combat operations, plus it adapted to NATO standards and progressive technologies! For this, many thanks to our real friends and brothers - the USA, Britain, Poland, Latvia, Lithuania, Estonia and many other countries and peoples!At the same time, Ukraine managed to create in less than 2 years what "great Russia" could not do in 20 years. Russia only got cartoons about "unparalleled weapons" The example with these surface drones is an example of how high-tech solutions help in the fight against terrorists from a technologically backward country! "The invincible Black Sea Fleet of the Russian Federation" - with a squeal and tantrums, they ran away from their places of deployment, while the vaunted "most protected naval base in the world" (well, again, according to the stupid fantasies of Russians) turned out to be full of holes like a sieve We are now witnessing a historical moment - the destruction and annihilation of perhaps the last inadequate empire, the collapse of the "colossus on fake legs" of the country of the international terrorist - Russia.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I'll take fundraisers I won't be donating to for $100 Alex.  This idea that peace will be attained if we grow our military to be bigger than the other guy's is such a stupid thought.  I'm reminded of a quote, "fighting for peace is like fucking for virginity."  Thinking that you can maintain peace in a warzone if you have more weapons and now trying to take the human element out of the killing aspect in order to give it to drones that can tirelessly police the area is the sort of thing that horror films are made from.  Watching the world of the future take shape is terrifying.  I'm glad I'm mortal.
